content.question: An oil storage tank has the shape as shown above, obtained by revolving the curve <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi> y </mi> <mo> = </mo> <mfrac> <mn> 9 </mn> <mrow> <mn> 625 </mn> </mrow> </mfrac> <msup> <mi> x </mi> <mn> 4 </mn> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF"> MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamyEaiabg2 da9maalaaabaGaaGyoaaqaaiaaiAdacaaIYaGaaGynaaaacaWG4bWa aWbaaSqabeaacaaI0aaaaaaa@3CF0@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> from x = 0 to x = 5 about the y -axis, where x and y are measured in feet. Oil weighing 50 pounds per cubic foot flowed into an initially empty tank at a constant rate of 8 cubic feet per minute. When the depth of oil reached 6 feet, the flow stopped. (a) Let h be the depth, in feet, of oil in the tank. How fast was the depth of oil in the tank increasing when <math> </math> h = 4 ? Indicate units of measure.

frqParts.text: An oil storage tank has the shape as shown above, obtained by revolving the curve <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi> y </mi> <mo> = </mo> <mfrac> <mn> 9 </mn> <mrow> <mn> 625 </mn> </mrow> </mfrac> <msup> <mi> x </mi> <mn> 4 </mn> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF"> MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamyEaiabg2 da9maalaaabaGaaGyoaaqaaiaaiAdacaaIYaGaaGynaaaacaWG4bWa aWbaaSqabeaacaaI0aaaaaaa@3CF0@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> from x = 0 to x = 5 about the y -axis, where x and y are measured in feet. Oil weighing 50 pounds per cubic foot flowed into an initially empty tank at a constant rate of 8 cubic feet per minute. When the depth of oil reached 6 feet, the flow stopped. (a) Let h be the depth, in feet, of oil in the tank. How fast was the depth of oil in the tank increasing when <math> </math> h = 4 ? Indicate units of measure.
(b) Find, to the nearest foot-pound, the amount of work required to empty the tank by pumping all of the oil back to the top of the tank.

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
